pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhāti na anuggaṇhāpeti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā gave the full admission to a disciple, but then, for the next two years, neither guided her nor had her guided.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.4.pli: na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.4.eng: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhissati na anuggaṇhāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.6.eng: “How can Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to a disciple, and then neither guide her nor have her guided for two years?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhāti na anuggaṇhāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhissati na anuggaṇhāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.10.eng: “How can the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.12.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇheyya na anuggaṇhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a disciple, and then, for the next two years, neither guides her nor has her guided, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.6.eng: a student is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.12.pli: na sayaṃ anuggaṇheyya uddesena paripucchāya ovādena anusāsaniyā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.12.eng: she does not herself guide her—through recitation, through questioning, through instruction, though teaching.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.14.eng: she does not ask anyone else.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.15.pli: “dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhissāmi na anuggaṇhāpessāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1.15.eng: If she thinks, “I’ll neither guide her nor have her guided for two years,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.2.3.eng: if she searches for someone to guide her, but cannot find anyone;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.2.8.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:0.5.eng: The training rule on not following one’s mentor

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.2.eng: At that time nuns who had received the full admission did not follow their mentors for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.4.pli: na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.4.eng: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.6.eng: “How can those nuns receive the full admission and then not follow their mentors for two years?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns don’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.12.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a nun does not follow the mentor who gave her the full admission for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.5.eng: Who gave her the full admission:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.6.eng: who gave her the full ordination.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.8.eng: the preceptor is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.12.eng: does not herself attend on her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.13.pli: Dve vassāni nānubandhissāmīti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.13.eng: If she thinks, “I won’t follow her for two years,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.2.pli: upajjhāyā bālā vā hoti alajjinī vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.2.eng: if the preceptor is ignorant or shameless;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.7.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:0.5.eng: The training rule on raw grain

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo sassakāle āmakadhaññaṃ viññāpetvā nagaraṃ atiharanti dvāraṭṭhāne—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.2.eng: it was the harvest season. At that time the nuns had asked for raw grain, which they then carried to town. At the town gate they were detained and told,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.5.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo upassayaṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.5.eng: they went to the nuns’ dwelling place and told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.7.eng: “How could nuns ask for raw grain?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo āmakadhaññaṃ viññāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī āmakadhaññaṃ viññatvā vā viññāpetvā vā bhajjitvā vā bhajjāpetvā vā koṭṭetvā vā koṭṭāpetvā vā pacitvā vā pacāpetvā vā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun asks for or has someone else ask for raw grain, or she roasts it or has it roasted, or she pounds it or has it pounded, or she cooks it or has it cooked, and she then eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.6.pli: sāli vīhi yavo godhumo kaṅgu varako kudrusako.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.6.eng: rice, barley, wheat, millet, wild gram, kodo millet.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.6.comm: I render sāli and vīhi with the single word “rice”. In total there are seven grains.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.10.eng: she gets someone else to ask.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.14.eng: she gets someone else to roast it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.18.eng: she gets someone else to pound it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.22.eng: she gets someone else to cook it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.23.eng: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.1.24.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.2.2.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc7:2.2.6.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:0.5.eng: The second training rule on disciples

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāseti na vūpakāsāpeti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā gave the full admission to a disciple, but then neither sent her away nor had her sent away.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.3.eng: And so her husband got hold of her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāsessati na vūpakāsāpessati, sāmiko aggahesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.5.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to a disciple, and then neither send her away nor have her sent away?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.6.pli: Sacāyaṃ bhikkhunī pakkantā assa, na ca sāmiko gaṇheyyā”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.6.eng: If this nun had gone away, her husband would not have gotten hold of her.” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāseti na vūpakāsāpeti, sāmiko aggahesī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā didn’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāsessati na vūpakāsāpessati, sāmiko aggahesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.10.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā not do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.12.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāseyya na vūpakāsāpeyya antamaso chappañcayojanānipi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a disciple, and then neither sends her away nor has her sent away at least 65 to 80 kilometers, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.10.eng: she does not herself send her away.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.10.comm: According to the commentary, this means actually grabbing the newly ordained person and personally taking her away. Sp 2.1116: Neva vūpakāseyyāti na gahetvā gaccheyya, “Neva vūpakāseyya means one does not take hold of her and leave.” The verb vūpakāseti, however, just means to cause separation; it does not imply such personal involvement.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.12.eng: she does not ask anyone else to send her away.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.13.pli: “Neva vūpakāsessāmi na vūpakāsāpessāmi antamaso chappañcayojanānipī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.13.eng: If she thinks, “I’ll neither send her away nor have her sent away, not even 65 to 80 kilometers,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.1.13.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.2.3.eng: if she searches for a companion nun for her, but cannot find anyone;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.2.8.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc70:2.2.9.eng: The seventh subchapter on pregnant women is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:0.5.eng: The training rule on unmarried girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to unmarried girls less than twenty years old.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.3.pli: Tā akkhamā honti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.3.eng: They were unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.4.pli: Uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātikā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.4.eng: and they were unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.6.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to unmarried girls less than twelve years old?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.11.pli: Ūnavīsativassā, bhikkhave, kumāribhūtā akkhamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.11.eng: An unmarried girl less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.12.eng: and she’s unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.13.pli: Vīsativassāva kho, bhikkhave, kumāribhūtā khamā hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.13.eng: But an unmarried girl who is twenty years old is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.16.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.17.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is less than twenty years old, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.5.eng: Who is less than twenty years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.6.eng: who has not reached twenty years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.8.eng: a novice nun is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.11.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.11.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.12.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.12.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.13.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.14.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.15.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.15.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.16.1.eng: If the girl is less than twenty years old, and the nun perceives her as less, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.17.eng: If the girl is less than twenty years old, but the nun is unsure of it, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.18.eng: If the girl is less than twenty years old, but the nun perceives her as more, and she gives her the full admission, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.19.eng: If the girl is more than twenty years old, but the nun perceives her as less, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.20.eng: If the girl is more than twenty years old, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.21.eng: If the girl is more than twenty years old, and the nun perceives her as more, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.23.eng: if she gives the full admission to a girl less than twenty years old, but she perceives her as more;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.24.eng: if she gives the full admission to a girl more than twenty years old, and she perceives her as more;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.26.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc71:2.27.eng: The first training rule is finished.
